metadata.Title: CVE-2022-22763 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
When a worker is shutdown, it was possible to cause script to run late inthe lifecycle, at a point after where it should not be possible. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 96, Thunderbird < 91.6, and Firefox ESR <91.6.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22763` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
